conclusion: Analyze the path of the liquid from each starting point (A, B, and C) to see where it ends up.
Liquid starts at point A, positioned at the top left of the image.
First baffle encountered by liquid from A is angled downwards to the right.
Liquid from A will follow the slope of the first baffle and move towards the right.
Next baffle encountered by liquid from A is angled downwards to the left.
Liquid from A will follow the slope of the second baffle and move towards the left.
Liquid from A will reach the bottom of the image and flow into container D.
Liquid starts at point B, positioned in the middle at the top of the image.
First baffle encountered by liquid from B is angled downwards to the left.
Liquid from B will follow the slope of the first baffle and move towards the left.
Next baffle encountered by liquid from B is angled downwards to the right.
Liquid from B will follow the slope of the second baffle and move towards the right.
Liquid from B will reach the bottom of the image and flow into container D.
Liquid starts at point C, positioned at the top right of the image.
First baffle encountered by liquid from C is angled downwards to the left.
Liquid from C will follow the slope of the first baffle and move towards the left.
Next baffle encountered by liquid from C is angled downwards to the right.
Liquid from C will follow the slope of the second baffle and move towards the right.
Liquid from C will reach the bottom of the image and flow into container E.
Final answer: Liquid from A will flow into container D, liquid from B will flow into container D, and liquid from C will flow into container E.
